dialogues.text: Morrison struggles to keep up with Marie's Bullit-esque d Kristen stays focused on the one-sided conversation in he headphones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Elena...Keep pushing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie's BMW screeches to a stop outside the beachfront co Marie strides towards the construction site entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena gets out the car, feeling decidedly sick. She circu adjusts the microphone taped to her chest, then follows M the dark, unfinished building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie enters the makeshift office like a wolf stalking he heading straight for the safe. With a rock steady hand, s the lock...CLICK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison brings his clunky Police sedan to a halt around of the building site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen listens intently to the live feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over headphones) Marie! Please, I can't do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie's working the safe combination like a master thief, it nimbly between her buffed nails. CLICK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena stands in the makeshift office doorway, trying to c something incriminating from Marie's perfect lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to kill Chad. I'll tell it to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie doesn't even look round, concentrating on the job a Elena's reeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell 'em you made me lie about your stepfather raping me, made me perjure myself on the stand, went and killed Chad, and now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) 99. A very good year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. Third and final tumbler falls. The safe door swing revealing a STACK of CASH and Jay's HANDGUN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen shakes her head. It's hopeless, Elena can't get M say an incriminating word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has gotta end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna end. One way or another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie pulls out a wad of crisp, clean bills, draws them a nose like a wine connoisseur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money. Always in style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dances over to Elena, waves the cash in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it? Why'd Chad have to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie slides up against Elena, fluttering the cash over h world's most expensive shower. Elena couldn't be less int focused on getting that confession...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him, Marie. You murdered him in cold blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie presses up against Elena, pushing her up against th unfinished dry wall. Kisses her passionately, finally sil her for a few, brief, electric seconds. And when she pull her fingers dance down Elena's shirt until...

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: he rips the microphone from Elena's chest. Stands there w dangling cord in her hands, her face caught in a permanen The blood drains from Elena's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piercing feedback forces Kristen to throw aside the hea She looks to Morrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen shakes her head resolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got us into this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! A GUNSHOT echoes in the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay in the car! Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison sprints over to the building site, leaving Krist car, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena stands with her hands up, an ugly bullet hole in th just beside her. Marie keeps Jay's gun trained on her as unloads the cash from the safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid fucking Sherbert. You think you could sell me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They made me do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison doesn't know his prick from a pogo stick. And that bitch Parole Officer, she hasn't got the balls for this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie takes dead aim once more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie's finger tightens on the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen tenses as the gunshot echoes throughout the const site. She reaches across to the driver's seat, grabs the SHOTGUN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena scrambles across the concrete floor, desperately tr make it to the relative safety of one of the support pill sees the forensic UV light switch on the floor, reaches f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands in the shattered doorway, surveys the expansive, u floor. Is about to unleash a hail of bullets when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WORK LIGHTS flicker out, replaced by the eerie ULTRA LIGHTS scattered around the unfinished floor...Bathed in florescent blue glow of the lights, Elena scrambles to sa behind a pillar. Her shirt GLOWS, her eyes like beacons..

dialogues.speaker: MORRISON
dialogues.text: Sweeps through the second floor, meticulously checking ev corner, every shadow...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Runs towards the unfinished building, looking up to the U the fourth floor. She sprints for the INDUSTRIAL ELEVATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: scours the bizarre darkness, hears a sound. BOOM! The ora muzzle flash illuminates the floor briefly as Marie shoot randomly. The flimsy plaster walls EXPLODE...

dialogues.speaker: MORRISON
dialogues.text: Enters the third floor from the fire escape, continues hi meticulous sweep of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands in the industrial elevator, jabbing the 4th floor hyperventilating as more gunshots EXPLODE. She clutches M shotgun to her chest, getting closer to the top floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shields herself as plaster rains down on her, unable to s through the cloud of dust under the UV lights, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A bullet sparks off rebar inches from her foot. She to see the barrel of Jay's gun. Marie's face is contorted maniacally as she squeezes down on the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs up the fire escape stairs when a final deafening GUN rings out. Followed by SCREAMS. He rips open the fourth f door, tearing through the building, pushing through thick sheeting until he finds himself under the UV glow.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: hick plumes of blood, black under the UV light, stain the and floor. He sees Elena, in a fetal ball, trembling uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside her, Marie lies dead, her chest a gaping crimson m Jay's gun still clutched tightly in her cold, dead hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen looks up at him, almost too shocked to speak.   M shotgun is still smoking in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have a choice. She was gonna kill Elena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison steps forward, calmly, takes the gun from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new crime scene is alive with activity. Cops, reporte bystanders. Morrison sips coffee as PARAMEDICS wheel Mari corpse to the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them hands something to Morrison. A blood-splatter digital video tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found this on the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison takes it without a word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got off the phone with the Parole board...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison turns around, sees Kristen approaching, still vi shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to bring Elena back to Miami in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... sorry for this whole mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison considers this, picks his words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. It was my gun that fired the shots, so it must've been me who pulled the trigger. I'll take the credit on this one. After all the Black widow crap I had to put up with, I've earnt it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: risten smiles, almost, moves in, and wraps her arms aroun Detective. He closes his eyes, savors the moment. As she away, she hands him a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call me, promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that this is all over, maybe we can have that drink soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans in, kisses him sweetly on the lips. Morrison wa walk away. In spite of all the shit that's gone down, he' probably the happiest son of a bitch in all of Blue Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison's unmarked Sedan idles outside the barbed wire f the County Jail. The gate slowly opens and guards lead a Clifford outside, wincing from the bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison gets out of the car, meets Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you holdin' up, Jay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. Everything's gone. Repossessed. Guess there's nowhere to go but up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all he can do to keep from breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help but feel partially responsible. If there's anything I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, but thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I at least give you a ride somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't got nowhere to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison watches sadly as Jay stumbles past him, walking nowhere in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) ... but up, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective heads back to his car, stops for a second, into his pocket and pulls out Kristen's already-dog eared can't resist. Dials the number After four rings there's n message. Just a BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Uh, Kristen, it's Michael again. Haven't heard from you. Hope you're doing okay. Everything's fine here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't been any questions asked that I can't answer, an' no one's brought your name up. So give me a call back and maybe we can go for that drink...

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: e's cut off by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP. The mail box you are trying to reach is full. Your message has been deleted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison's disconnected. Puzzled, he gets into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison gets the shock of his life when he enters the us quiet police station and finds himself in the midst of ut pandemonium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Officers are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to pick his way through the crowd when he's inte by Officer Entwistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better come with me, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entwistle leads Morrison into his office, where Agent Dam behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Morrison. So good to finally see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, Dammers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be asking you the same question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison stands in the middle of the evidence locker, dum Dammers watches him, his arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Morrison. Every last bit of evidence from the Black Widow case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention the money you confiscated. All $427,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd be able to answer that question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's name are you talking about? I didn't have anything to do with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your key card was the last one that opened this locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison's heart is beating a mile a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Kristen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRETTY RECEPTIONIST sits behind a sparse desk when the rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D ade County Parole. How can I direct your call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison paces back and forth, on the phone, as Dammers w not saying a word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) This is Detective Morrison, Blue Bay PD. I was wondering if you had a forwarding number for Kristen Richards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen Richards. She's one of your officers. Has cases up here in Blue Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist's fingers nimbly dance across the keyboa front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Detective. There's no one here by that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course there is. I worked with her personally. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no record of a Kristen Richards ever working here. Besides, Blue Bay's out of our jurisdiction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison struggles to control his emotions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. No, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft waves lap against a pristine beach. Palm trees sway warm breeze. A steady WHIRRING is the only sound that dis serenity. Is it a lawn mower? A leaf blower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a gorgeous beach house with a patio looking out o idyllic scene. The swimming pool glistens in the bright t Caribbean Sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stretched out on a recliner in the sheerest of bikini other than Kristen Richards, soaking up rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At her side is a PAPER SHREDDER, and between sips from a colada, she feeds document after document, each one stamp WIDOW EVIDENCE in red ink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen looks over at Elena, equally stunning in a matchi bikini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Morrison just handed me the key to the evidence locker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A broad grin stretches across her lips as Elena empties t contents of a velvet pouch onto a table.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he Mother-Daughter diamonds are radiant in the bright sun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are...genuine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' like the real thing. Switched 'em for the fakes right after Marie tried to pay me off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're...So beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena picks up the bigger diamond, hands it to Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen picks up the smaller diamond, hands it to Elena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison paces the infamous crime scene, at wit's end. Da stands off to the side, just watching him with a bemused etched across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the Black Widow. Her and that little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to think of an appropriate slur for Elena. Can't with anything, continues pacing frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Played me like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammers shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hind sight's 20-20. No need to be so hard on yourself, Morrison... (beat, smile) That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smug son of a bitch. It's not like you knew who she was anymore than I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammers nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the God's honest truth. But at least I didn't give her my evidence locker keycard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I didn't lie about who fired the shots that killed the Clifford kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison's heart sinks. He looks like he's going to faint Steadies himself, placing both hands against the wall, ju did that fateful night seemingly a lifetime ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammers leads Morrison to his awaiting car. They pass MR. and Cicatriz. Mr. Barajas is in his usual foul mood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un pinche sink hole! No lo puedo creer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison stops, regards Barajas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foundation is sinking. The entire site is a sink hole. It's completely worthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill Jay Clifford...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me both...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena and Kristen lay side-by-side on loungers, soaking i sun, when a voice rouses them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Detective Morrison. It's hard to do that to a friend. Especially one going through such a nasty divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up to see Jay, standing before them in a pair o colorful shorts, no shirt, sipping at a martini...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told me he'd never trust another woman as long as he lived. And then along came a spider...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black widow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay glances at Elena, as he downs the last drops from his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like widows... Gotta say I was a little taken aback when you wanted to snuff Marie, but you know what, I'm over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena suddenly gets to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to top you off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be fine, just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Elena his empty glass, then kisses Kristen tende When they break...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a good head on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen doesn't reply. Just smiles, watches Elena over by outside bar, mixing Jay's drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two got me out of a mountain of shit, I'll tell you that. Craziest Goddamn scheme I've ever heard of. But hell, you played it perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job was easy. It was Elena who had to keep it all together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had some practice along the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay turns around, smiles at Elena as she holds out his dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Mr. Clifford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay takes it from her appreciatively, sips at it as he si to the swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all that nasty business, it's behind us. Forever. From here on out, it's the good life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to climb the high dive. When he gets to the top looks down at Elena and Kristen, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two look so good, it's difficult to tell which one's the mother and which one's the daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen calls back up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the roofies talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says it so sweetly, it takes a moment for Jay to register sinister implications...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are blood shot. He starts to sway atop the high

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta Chi, class of '88. Hellova party. I'd never really tasted cocktails like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay's swaying uneasily on the high dive platform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...whattya talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like being awake though an operation. I could feel everything happening, but I couldn't do anything to stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took something from me that night. But you left something behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay's head is spinning as he looks to Kristen, to Elena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't quite get his mind around it. Everything's becom blurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the martini glass, thinks he sees blue residu it slips from his fingers, falls 20 feet to the concrete shattering into a million pieces like so many fake diamon

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: lena and Kristen stand side-by-side below him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A broad grin stretches across Elena's lips as she finishe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But you'll never forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay tries to take a step forward. He stumbles. Tries in v regain his balance. It's too late. He falls. 20 feet to t unyielding concrete, exploding like a paper bag filled wi vegetable soup...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice take off. Gotta work on the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand back, watching Jay's pancaked body draining it precious blood into the ice blue pool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go get our money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gather the diamonds, walk away as the pool turns cri red...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the credits roll....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anonymous, luxurious office. A fat, balding, semi-cons lies curled up on the floor as Elena, half undressed and black wig, shovels cash into her oversized purse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a crackle on her WALKIE-TALKIE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got problems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside, she can hear the wailing of SIRENS. Getting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena gets hesitantly to her feet, slides a stack of $100 pocket for good measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gonna be able to make an ID?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena glances at the Man on the floor, his puffy eyes gla like a jelly donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on your life. I gave him enough roofies to make an elephant forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena gets into a waiting car outside the bank. The getaw driver...Kristen, of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we just gave up all that cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. The Black Widow's finally got an angle on our real prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We goin' to Blue Bay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't know what hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile crosses Elena's perfect lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'bout time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the car pulls away from the curb just seconds before of police cars screeches to a halt in front of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay carefully places the stacks of cash into the wall saf unfinished office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an awful lot of money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay spins round, flabbergasted that someone's watching hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough though. Gonna need those Diamonds if you're gonna ride out this disaster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What the hell do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen calmly reaches into her purse, pulls out a handfu marbles. Throws them onto the ground, letting them roll t

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: Jay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut they stop, change direction, all coming rolling back i small circle, until they come to rest in the middle of th concrete floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building's built on a sink hole, Jay. You know it, and I know it. Gonna need to think fast if you wanna keep the Cubans off your back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay's tiny mind can't take it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you...how'd you know all this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena walks seductively into the unfinished office. It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie sits in the bleachers by the side of the school div looking at her Mother's soon-to-be-diamond ring through t eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want what's mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena stalks the bleachers behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diamonds are your inheritance. You deserve them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fucking Step-Monster'll never give me the Goddamn key...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena jumps down the bleachers, sits down next to Marie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you take it, one way or another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind closed doors, Chad's completing yet another dubiou transaction, handing over a bag of roofies. The buyer thi time...Marie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take a check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money talks, bullshit walks. I got strippers to feed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie fishes out the money from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like to make some real cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad likes the sound of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's that simple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad uses Jay's teeth mouldings to bite Elena, as Marie t Jay's video camera on her, wailing on her in a drunken st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it, bitch. No pain, no gain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena's face is pressed against the concrete wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad sits at his video console, all alone, expertly manip the audio and video footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll put you right here, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad presses play. On the video screen a frightened Elena huddled against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon now baby, you can do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena watches as Marie and Theo drive away, then turns to glistening Mother Daughter diamonds. She opens a case wit identical GLASS REPLICAS, and replaces the diamonds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the while, Uncle Marty SNORES his head off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Uncle Marty, irritated) Will you knock that off? They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Marty's eyes snap open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen and Marie are sunning themselves on the crystalli when someone stands before them, casting a shadow over th sizzling bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're blocking our sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks over her sunglasses at...Uncle Marty...Only all cle in a pair of Bermuda shorts that show off his milky white He clutches a briefcase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies. Hellova job back there. Your best ever if I might be so bold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our biggest score. You sure you can move it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen nods to the briefcase in Uncle Marty's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see the green...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Marty lays the case down on the lounger, opens it, stacks of cash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got another lead, if you're interested. Was just up in Boston, surveying a mansion that's just been sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Termites already eaten most of it. Owner's shitting bricks. There's gotta be an angle for the Black Widows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen and Elena look to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. We had a good run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Marty shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame. Guess all good things come to an end. So, the diamonds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena reaches down, pulls the diamonds from the sand. Han over and is about to take the case of money when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know these are the real thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena looks to Kristen. They smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to trust us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fuck.
